summary:
PTSD is a mental health condition that can develop after experiencing a traumatic event like assault, war, or accidents. Symptoms include upsetting memories, feeling stressed when reminded of the trauma, and avoiding similar situations. It can also cause changes in mood and increase alertness. People with PTSD might be at risk of self-harm.

Not everyone who goes through trauma gets PTSD. It's more common in those who experience violence, like rape or abuse. Treatment includes therapy and medication. Many people in the U.S. experience PTSD, and it's more common in women. The condition has been recognized for centuries but was officially named in the 1970s.
title: Post-traumatic stress disorder
